author: Heidi Mitchell
title: The Big Impact of a Little Rudeness at Work
text:
Witnessing rudeness in the morning can hurt a person’s job performance all day, a new study suggests.
These findings, from a team of researchers led by Andrew Woolum, an assistant professor of management at the University of North Carolina, Wilmington, add to a growing body of research showing the serious costs of rudeness. Previous research by Dr. Woolum and his colleagues showed that rudeness—often defined by researchers as low-intensity deviant behavior with ambiguous intent to harm—is as contagious as the common cold.
